snippet: Leaders of pro-Russian groups in eastern Ukraine said Thursday that they would proceed with the referendum, despite Russian President Vladimir V. Putin’s plea to postpone the vote.
abstract: Pro-Russian militants in eastern Ukraine vow to press ahead with referendum seeking autonomy; risky move seems to defy their political patron, Russian Pres Vladimir V Putin, whose motives in urging delay in vote come under attack by Ukrainian officials.

byline.original: By C. J. CHIVERS and DAVID M. HERSZENHORN
byline.contributor: C. J. Chivers reported from Slovyansk, and David M. Herszenhorn from Kiev, Ukraine. Reporting was contributed by Noah Sneider in Slovyansk, Michael D. Shear in Washington and Neil MacFarquhar and Andrew Roth in Moscow.

lead_paragraph: Leaders of pro-Russian groups in eastern Ukraine said Thursday that they would proceed with the referendum, despite Russian President Vladimir V. Putin’s plea to postpone the vote.

headline.main: Separatists Defy Kiev and Putin on Referendum
headline.print_headline: Ukraine Rebels Push for Vote, Defying Patron
